org.barghos.core.color

Class LDRColor4

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.barghos.core.color.LDRColor4
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IColor3R, IColor4R, IColor4W, ILDRColor3R, ILDRColor4R, ILDRColor4W, ITup3fR, ITup4fR, ITup4fW, ITupfR, ITupfW

    public class LDRColor4
extends java.lang.Object
implements ILDRColor4R, ILDRColor4W
    This class is a simple implementation of an LDRColor4.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LDRColor4()
      This is the default constructor.
      LDRColor4(double scalar)
      This constructor sets the components to scalar.
      LDRColor4(double r, double g, double b, double a)
      This constructor sets the components to r, g, b and a.
      LDRColor4(int scalar)
      This constructor sets the components to scalar.
      LDRColor4(int r, int g, int b, int a)
      This constructor sets the components to r, g, b and a.
      LDRColor4(ITup4dR t)
      This constructor sets the components to t.
      LDRColor4(ITup4fR t)
      This constructor sets the components to t.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getA()
      Returns the alpha component in colorrange (0 - 255).
      int getB()
      Returns the blue component in colorrange (0 - 255).
      int getDimensions()
      Returns the count of dimensions of the tuple.
      int getG()
      Returns the green component in colorrange (0 - 255).
      int getR()
      Returns the red component in colorrange (0 - 255).
      float getUnityA()
      Returns the alpha component in unitspace (0 - 1).

      Returns the blue component in unitspace (0 - 1).
      float getUnityG()
      Returns the green component in unitspace (0 - 1).
      float getUnityR()
      Returns the red component in unitspace (0 - 1).

      Sets the x, y, z and w component to t.

      Sets the rgba components to the values of t.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LDRColor4

        public LDRColor4()
        This is the default constructor. It is commonly used by a pool. It sets all components to 0.0 what is equal to black color.

      • LDRColor4

        public LDRColor4(ITup4dR t)
        This constructor sets the components to t. The values of t are interpreted as in unitspace (0.0 - 1.0) and are clamped to these limit.
        Parameters:
        t - A tuple that the components are set to.

      • LDRColor4

        public LDRColor4(ITup4fR t)
        This constructor sets the components to t. The values of t are interpreted as in unitspace (0.0 - 1.0) and are clamped to these limit.
        Parameters:
        t - A tuple that the components are set to.

      • LDRColor4

        public LDRColor4(double scalar)
        This constructor sets the components to scalar. The scalar is interpreted as in unitspace (0.0 - 1.0) and are clamped to these limit.
        Parameters:
        scalar - A value that the components are set to.

      • LDRColor4

        public LDRColor4(int scalar)
        This constructor sets the components to scalar. The scalar is interpreted as in colorrange (0 - 255) and are clamped to these limit.
        Parameters:
        scalar - A value that the components are set to.

      • LDRColor4

        public LDRColor4(double r,
                 double g,
                 double b,
                 double a)
        This constructor sets the components to r, g, b and a. r, g, b and are interpreted as in unitspace (0.0 - 1.0) and are clamped to these limit.
        Parameters:
        r - The red component in unitspace.
        g - The green component in unitspace.
        b - The blue component in unitspace.
        a - The alpha component in unitspace.

      • LDRColor4

        public LDRColor4(int r,
                 int g,
                 int b,
                 int a)
        This constructor sets the components to r, g, b and a. r, g, b and a are interpreted as in colorspace (0 - 255) and are clamped to these limit.
        Parameters:
        r - The red component in colorspace.
        g - The green component in colorspace.
        b - The blue component in colorspace.
        a - The alpha component in colorspace.
